structure.unit: A UNIFORM MILITARY AND OVERSEAS VOTERS ACT

law.text: To be valid, a military-overseas ballot shall be received by the appropriate local election official not later than the time established by the election laws generally for the closing of the polls, which time shall not include the extra hour during which those voters may vote who were waiting in line to vote at the scheduled poll closing time.
law.history: Created 2013 Ky. Acts ch. 131, sec. 10, effective July 1, 2014.
